citations.narrative:
***In the exhibition area of the facility, there were eighteen Guineas, fourteen Chickens and two Peafowl. Even though the
facility was closed to the public, the exhibition area was open to the parking lot, next to the highway, and no one was in
the immediate area. There was no fencing or gate to securely contain the birds to the exhibition area.
Free roaming birds that are not contained to a secure area may wander and become injured.
The licensee must ensure that housing facilities employ security measures that contain all birds securely as required.
To be corrected by August 29, 2023.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
***In the exhibition area, there was an enclosure containing a female pig with four suckling piglets. The female pig was
thin across the back ridgeline and hips and had areas of hair loss across the shoulders, spine and hips. The licensee
stated that the piglets would be weaned this week and that the people at Tractor Supply suggested doubling the feed for
the female pig. A veterinarian had not been contacted.
Thin animals that are not provided with appropriate supplements during nursing activities can lead to declining health for
both mothers and young.
The licensee must contact a licensed veterinarian and follow the recommendations. The licensee must ensure that the
use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries be provided to all animals as
required.
To be corrected by August 25, 2023.

***In the exhibition area, there was an enclosure housing one female pig. There was a cattle panel that was used as
fencing on a portion of this enclosure. One end of the panel was attached near the edge of the shed. The other end of the
panel was not attached to any stable object. This pig was large enough to push the panel and escape the enclosure.
Enclosures that are not securely constructed allow escape opportunities for the animals.
The licensee must attach the loose end of the panel to a stable object and ensure that indoor and outdoor housing
facilities are structurally sound and are maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the
animals as required.
To be corrected by August 24, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
CYNTHIA DIGESUALDO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.150(a) 
   
 
***In the exhibition area of the facility, there were eighteen Guineas, fourteen Chickens and two Peafowl. Even though the 
facility was closed to the public, the exhibition area was open to the parking lot, next to the highway, and no one was in 
the immediate area. There was no fencing or gate to securely contain the birds to the exhibition area.  
Free roaming birds that are not contained to a secure area may wander and become injured. 
The licensee must ensure that housing facilities employ security measures that contain all birds securely as required.  
To be corrected by August 29, 2023. 
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
***In the exhibition area, there was an enclosure containing a female pig with four suckling piglets. The female pig was 
thin across the back ridgeline and hips and had areas of hair loss across the shoulders, spine and hips. The licensee 
stated that the piglets would be weaned this week and that the people at Tractor Supply suggested doubling the feed for 
the female pig. A veterinarian had not been contacted. 
Thin animals that are not provided with appropriate supplements during nursing activities can lead to declining health for 
both mothers and young.  
The licensee must contact a licensed veterinarian and follow the recommendations. The licensee must ensure that the 
use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries be provided to all animals as 
required. 
To be corrected by August 25, 2023. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
***In the exhibition area, there was an enclosure housing one female pig. There was a cattle panel that was used as 
fencing on a portion of this enclosure. One end of the panel was attached near the edge of the shed. The other end of the 
panel was not attached to any stable object. This pig was large enough to push the panel and escape the enclosure.  
Enclosures that are not securely constructed allow escape opportunities for the animals. 
The licensee must attach the loose end of the panel to a stable object and ensure that indoor and outdoor housing 
facilities are structurally sound and are maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the

animals as required. 
To be corrected by August 24, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
CYNTHIA DIGESUALDO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
